exceptions.exn: In environment u, v, a, b : nat H : u <> 0 H0 : v <> 0 H1 : is_gcd u v 1 H2 : forall u v : nat, nat -> nat -> u <> 0 -> v <> 0 -> is_gcd u v 1 -> nat Unable to unify "nat" with "exists w : nat, rem w u = rem a u /\\ rem w v = rem b v /\\ 2 < w".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: nat
a: nat
v: nat
u: nat

Goal:
u <> 0 -> v <> 0 -> is_gcd u v 1 -> exists w : nat, rem w u = rem a u /\ rem w v = rem b v /\ 2 < w

Premises:
rem = fun q p : nat => proj1_sig (projT2 (div_full q p)) : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments rem (_ _)%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
CRT_bin_informative : forall u v a b : nat, u <> 0 -> v <> 0 -> is_gcd u v 1 -> {w : nat | rem w u = rem a u /\ rem w v = rem b v /\ 2 < w}
CRT_informative : forall (n : nat) (m v : vec nat n), (forall p : pos n, vec_pos m p <> 0) -> (forall p q : pos n, p <> q -> is_gcd (vec_pos m p) (vec_pos m q) 1) -> {w : nat | forall p : pos n, rem w (vec_pos m p) = rem (vec_pos v p) (vec_pos m p)}
bezout_generalized_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> {a : nat & {b : nat & {g : nat & {l : nat & {u : nat & {v : nat | a * p + b * q = g + l /\ is_gcd p q g /\ is_lcm p q l /\ p = u * g /\ q = v * g /\ a <= v /\ b <= u}}}}}}
rem_plus_div : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a b : nat, divides p b -> rem a p = rem (a + b) p
rem_lt : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a : nat, a < p -> rem a p = a
rem_2_mult : forall x y : nat, rem (x * y) 2 = 1 < -> rem x 2 = 1 /\ rem y 2 = 1
sums.mscal_0 : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u x : X), sums.mscal m u 0 x = u
divides_rem_congr : forall p q a b : nat, divides p q -> rem a q = rem b q -> rem a p = rem b p
is_lcm_plus : forall p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + p) (l + u * p)
is_lcm_minus : forall p q g l u : nat, p <= q -> p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q - p) (l - u * p)
is_gcd_rel_prime : forall p q g : nat, is_gcd p q g -> exists a b : nat, p = a * g /\ q = b * g /\ is_gcd a b 1
rem_diag : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem p p = 0
euclid_2_div : forall n : nat, n = rem n 2 + 2 * div n 2 /\ (rem n 2 = 0 \/ rem n 2 = 1)
is_lcm_moduplus : forall k p q g l u : nat, p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q + k * p) (l + k * u * p)
Nat.pow_gt_1 : forall a b : nat, 1 < a -> b <> 0 -> 1 < a ^ b
vec_head_tail : forall (X : Type) (n : nat) (v : vec X (S n)), v = vec_head v ## vec_tail v
is_lcm_modulus : forall k p q g l u : nat, k * p <= q -> p = u * g -> is_gcd p q g -> is_lcm p q l -> is_lcm p (q - k * p) (l - k * u * p)
div_rem_spec2 : forall q p : nat, p <> 0 -> rem q p < p
rem_2_is_0_or_1 : forall x : nat, rem x 2 = 0 \/ rem x 2 = 1
bezout_rel_prime_lt : forall p q : nat, 0 < p < q -> is_gcd p q 1 -> {a : nat & {b : nat | a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q /\ a <= q /\ b <= p}}
sums.mscal_S : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X) (n : nat) (x : X), sums.mscal m u (S n) x = m x (sums.mscal m u n x)
rem_plus : forall p a b : nat, rem (a + b) p = rem (rem a p + rem b p) p
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
rem_plus_rem : forall p a b : nat, rem (a + rem b p) p = rem (a + b) p
rem_mult_rem : forall p a b : nat, rem (a * rem b p) p = rem (a * b) p
divides_rem_rem : forall p q a : nat, divides p q -> rem (rem a q) p = rem a p
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker_sound : forall (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof), ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker f w = true -> forall env : RingMicromega.PolEnv BinNums.Z, Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env) f
div_full : forall q p : nat, {n : nat & {r : nat | q = n * p + r /\ (p <> 0 -> r < p)}}
euclid : forall n d : nat, d <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | n = q * d + r /\ r < d}}
rem_2_fix_1 : forall n : nat, rem (2 * n) 2 = 0
bezout_nc : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 1 -> exists a b : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + p * q
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
pos_S_inv : forall p : pos (S ?n), (p = pos0) + {q : pos ?n | p = pos_nxt q} where ?n : [u : nat v : nat a : nat b : nat |- nat]
rem_2_fix_2 : forall n : nat, rem (1 + 2 * n) 2 = 1
rem_idem : forall q p : nat, q < p -> rem q p = q
rem_scal : forall p k a : nat, rem (k * a) p = rem (k * rem a p) p
rem_of_0 : forall p : nat, rem 0 p = 0
rem_erase : forall q n p r : nat, q = n * p + r -> rem q p = rem r p
rem_prop : forall q p n r : nat, q = n * p + r -> r < p -> rem q p = r

```intros.
intros H1 H2 H3.
apply CRT_bin_informative; assumption.
```

original: intros. intros H1 H2 H3. apply CRT_bin_informative; auto.
